intro: Physaria kingii subsp. kingii, commonly known as the King's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its swollen, seed-containing pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Physaria kingii subsp. kingii is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
